meanings.definition: In a foolish or naive manner.
meanings.sent1: He softheadedly believed everything he read online.
meanings.sent2: She softheadedly followed the advice without questioning it.
meanings.sent3: The tourist softheadedly trusted the stranger to show him around the city.
meanings.sent4: The child softheadedly thought the moon was following him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The student softheadedly copied the wrong answers from his friend's paper.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of intelligence or common sense.
meanings.sent1: His softheadedly decision led to a lot of trouble.
meanings.sent2: The softheadedly idea was quickly dismissed by the team.
meanings.sent3: The softheadedly plan to build a house of cards failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The softheadedly excuse did not convince anyone.
meanings.sent5: The softheadedly mistake cost him the game.

meanings.definition: Acting in a weak or easily influenced way.
meanings.sent1: She felt softheadedly after being persuaded to buy unnecessary items.
meanings.sent2: The softheadedly character always let others make decisions for him.
meanings.sent3: The softheadedly puppy followed its owner everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The softheadedly politician changed his stance based on public opinion.
meanings.sent5: The softheadedly employee never stood up for himself in meetings.
